instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not booting after repair
threads.message:
This one arrived with no green/orange light at all. Physical examination revealed corrosion on <CAPACITOR>C5002</CAPACITOR>.
After replacing <CAPACITOR>C5002</CAPACITOR>, I got USB activity and only with a screen connected booted up fine to the flashing question mark.

I put the board in a case, connected cables and added an SSD; no boot. Green/orange, fan spin, nothing else.
I removed everything one by one hoping to pinpoint the issue but the bare board alone is no longer booting (no USB activity).

SMC bypass does not make any changes.

Don't remember if it is the normal behaviour but upon connecting the power fan spins for about 5-6 seconds, then stops for 1-2 seconds and starts again. It does this just once, not repeated reboots.

Carefully examined the rest of the board for liquid damage however it is very clean with no obvious issues.

Are there any clues above indicating what might be the next problem? I am not sure where to go next.

EDIT:
PPBUS 8.6V
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> is 1.8V 
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 3.3v

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not booting after repair
threads.message:
This board should start directly, without any restart.

Test the board alone on the desk.
Check all SPI Bus Termination resistors and their traces.
Inspect J6100 for corrosion; clean it, if needed.

You can also try known good BIOS.
Don't forget to make backup first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Not booting after repair
threads.message:
Well, this morning I recalled that after the board working the first time, I applied liberal amounts of IPA to clean it properly. I suspected that the alcohol went under the SMC as well and perhaps relocated some of the dirt that was already parked there. I Reflown the SMC and now everything is working back again. Lesson learned.

Thanks for the help.
